docs.snippet: Kentucky's Republican governor has won an initial round in his court fight over whether he violated free-speech rights by blocking people from his Facebook and Twitter accounts.

headline.print_headline: Kentucky Governor Wins Initial Round in Social Media Fight
headline.main: Kentucky Governor Wins Initial Round in Social Media Fight

docs.snippet: Apple is introducing new tools that will allow consumers  to control how their data are used and deactivate their Apple ID accounts, as tech companies strive to bring their services into line with a tough new EU data protection law.

headline.print_headline: Apple Unveils New Privacy Tools Ahead of EU Law
headline.main: Apple Unveils New Privacy Tools Ahead of EU Law

docs.snippet: A vegan in France who posted a Facebook message offering "zero sympathy" for a butcher killed by an Islamist militant during an attack last week was handed a seven-month suspended prison sentence for the remarks on Thursday, a judicial source said...

headline.print_headline: French Vegan Convicted for Comments on Butcher Killed by Islamist Militant
headline.main: French Vegan Convicted for Comments on Butcher Killed by Islamist Militant

docs.snippet: The Times interviewed Ms. Barr before the premiere of the reboot of “Roseanne.” Some readers praised her outspokenness; others said they would boycott her show.

headline.print_headline: ‘I Have New Respect for Her’: Readers Weigh In on Roseanne Barr
headline.main: ‘I Have New Respect for Her’: Readers Weigh In on Roseanne Barr

docs.snippet: The leader of Britain's left-leaning Labour Party is facing intensifying criticism from outsiders and some of his own members for what is viewed as a failure to address reports of anti-Semitism involving some Labour supporters.

headline.print_headline: UK Labour Leader Criticized for Anti-Semitism in Party
headline.main: UK Labour Leader Criticized for Anti-Semitism in Party

docs.snippet: Germany claimed another sporting world title as Saxonia Globe Snippers won this year's World Marbles Championship in Tinsley Green, near London Gatwick Airport.

headline.print_headline: German Team Wins Marbles World Title
headline.main: German Team Wins Marbles World Title

docs.snippet: Though Facebook gets the attention because of a recent privacy gaffe, the social network is far from alone in collecting massive amounts of data on you to help marketers sell you stuff.

headline.print_headline: How You're Tracked Online _ and What You Can Do About It
headline.main: How You're Tracked Online _ and What You Can Do About It

docs.snippet: Americans should be able to control their personal information, too.

A heated Facebook exchange over President Donald Trump brought Secret Service agents to a North Carolina man's door. But it wasn't until he made a profane defense of his First-Amendment rights that they slapped him with a criminal charge.

headline.print_headline: Man Charged After Profane Defense of Anti-Trump Online Post
headline.main: Man Charged After Profane Defense of Anti-Trump Online Post

docs.snippet: Fund managers have begun to ditch so-called FANG stocks that powered the U.S. stock market to record highs in January and are slowly rotating into commodity-related shares and other value stocks which typically outperform in late-cycle recoveries....

headline.print_headline: FANG Stocks' Bite Has U.S. Fund Managers Looking for Alternatives
headline.main: FANG Stocks' Bite Has U.S. Fund Managers Looking for Alternatives
